@outdoorguernsey, looking great! with the wind finally falling light & the tidal currents calming done somewhat too. Send some pics pls. GWF

RT @Lesbonsamis: @gsyweatherfox 
Thought you might like this shot of Club Bons Amis sand art done at Petit Port on Wednesday. http://t.co/L…
@Lesbonsamis, that's a beauty. I've been banging on all week about Petit Port being super sandy & sheltered. Great to see this pic. Thanks.
@outdoorguernsey sorry I deleted the forecast you retweeted this morning, because it had the wrong date on it. The correct one is done now.
The moon is falling over the W coast right now, + the most gorgeous reflection. Superb if someone could snap & send me a picture now please.

Tenner Fest next week!

Brittany skies have been flashing with lightning for the past hour. So no shooting stars tonight, but the sky might still put on a show.
GWF
@SpireWeather best of luck with that, you should be in for a bit of a display by the look of things. My update will be issued around 7:30am.

UPDATE: that sunshine was V brief ! & the F7 gusts don't feel too toasty.
Thunder now btwn Nantes and Lemans, prob starting here btwn 8&10pm
@beachystargazer sorry kate. Only just read this, but hopefully you read what I had wrote in yesterday's forecast. I said a very low chance.

Here's my full forecast for the coming fortnight, updated this morning...

http://t.co/oWZCS1iYer

UPDATE: those showers are getting a bit close for comfort, the 80mile gap has closed to 20miles. So far, so good tho, keep looking West.
GWF

A few flashes of lightning observed from the heavy shower that's approaching, keep em peeled now (and hurry up and unpeg that washing).
GWF

@LouiseTabor sorry I didn't get an alert for this, so I only just read it. Hope you chose Vazon, the surf was great. Fermain tomorrow.
GWF

Since this morning's unexpectedly heavy downpour, we've escaped with close shaves. The next one has our name on it though, (5:20pm-ish).
GWF

Late breakfast for my family, after epic fun in winter-sized surf with blazing summer sunshine. Anybody got me snaps of the huge waves?
GWF

It's 5pm & the airport's gone from 24 to 24.4°C since 4pm.
Town's held steady between 23 and 24° for a few hours now.
Swim time I think.
GWF
@captaintash thanks, great pic and what a gorgeous evening hey, I can hear the music of wedding parties bouncing around the island. Perfect.

My favourite feature of this cool airmass, is the outstanding visibility. Views are HD in all directions.
Careful though; the UV is intense.

Check out @BBCGuernsey tomorrow morning between 7 and 8, when I will give a speedy summary of the summer to come.
Sleep well y'all.
GWF
@Wardjenner @DavidPiesing63 Hi, no I'm not a pilot but I was an aviation forecaster at the M.O. for 5yr. Glad you like my forecasts. Thanks.

The wind is backing southerly, so the rain is progressing faster now. Persistent drizzle from around 5pm, with hill fog likely from 6pm. GWF

We crossed the 22°C mark super-late; at 6:20pm!
Thundery showers now developing at 50°N, but heading away from us, toward the Isle of Wight.
